Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* conflate_add_ping_report)(void *opaque, const char *set, const kvpair_t *pair)

Callback for conflate ping reports.

When performing a ping test, results are given back in named sets, one for each input under test.

Parameters:
opaque value given in the ping report callback
set a key indicating which of the calling sets is being reported
pair detailed information about this set's test

typedef void(* conflate_add_stat)(void *opaque, const char *k, const char *v)

Callback for conflate stats.

The key and value parameters represent the stat name and value that should be reported.

Parameters:
opaque value given in the stat callback
k a stat key (may not be NULL)
v a stat value (may not be NULL)

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum conflate_log_level

Log levels.

Enumerator:
DEBUG  Various debug messages (for example xmpp stanzas).
INFO  Info messages that might be helpful.
WARN  Warnings of stuff going bad.
ERROR  Noteworthy error conditions.
FATAL  The rapture is upon us.

enum conflate_mgmt_cb_result

Callback return types indicating status and result type of a management callback.

Enumerator:
RV_ERROR  Invocation failed.

RV_BADARG  Bad/incomplete arguments.
RV_EMPTY  Invocation succeeded, but no result should be returned.

RV_KVPAIR  Invocation succeeded and a simple kv pair list should be returned.

RV_LIST  Invocation succeeded and a list of kv pair lists should be returned.

Function Documentation

void conflate_register_mgmt_cb ( const char *  cmd,
const char *  desc,
conflate_mgmt_cb_t  cb 
)

Register a management command handler.

Callbacks allow applications using libconflate to register arbitrary callbacks to extend the capabilities of the management layer.

There are three major forms of success results:

  • Empty (no specific results necessary)
  • A simple key/multi-value list.
  • A list of key/multi-value lists.

See the definition of conflate_mgmt_cb_t for more information on result types.

Parameters:
cmd the node name of the command
desc short description of the command
cb the callback to issue when this command is invoked

void init_conflate ( conflate_config_t *  conf  ) 

Initilize the given configuration to defaults.

This should be called *before* you fill in your config.

Parameters:
conf configuration to be initialized

bool start_conflate ( conflate_config_t  conf  ) 

The main entry point for starting a conflate agent.

Parameters:
conf configuration for libconflate
Returns:
true if libconflate was able to properly initialize itself

Variable Documentation

enum conflate_mgmt_cb_result(* conflate_mgmt_cb_t)(void *opaque, conflate_handle_t *handle, const char *cmd, bool direct, kvpair_t *pair, void **result)

Callback invoked to process a management command.

Parameters:
opaque registered opaque value
handle the conflate handle
cmd the name of the command being executed
direct if true, this is a directed command (else issued via pubsub)
pair the form sent with this command (may be NULL)
result pointer to the results
